title: Bug 4964: Automatic Code Assist needs to be smarter
description: Since DISPOSED is first in the list and is selected, I ended up with: button.DISPOSED which isn't even close to what I want, and I have to delete it all and start again, paying more attention this time. Code assist should notice that I have typed a ( and that this matches "dispose()" far better than "DISPOSED". Either that, or it needs to be case sensitive when it is automatically inserting stuff.
OB: When typing "button.DISPOSED", the code assist list automatically selects "DISPOSED" instead of suggesting "dispose()" as a better match.
EB: The code assist should take into account the presence of opening parentheses and suggest "dispose()" instead of "DISPOSED".
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the code editor and start typing the code: button.dispose
2. Pay attention to the code assist list as you type.

Expected result: The code assist suggests "dispose()" as a better match for the typed code.

Actual result: The code assist selects "DISPOSED" instead of suggesting "dispose()".
